result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jan Eugene Gregerson in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  
Motion filed by Defense - Bail Modification - (Reduction of WCS visits or Return of $1,000 on one file to allow the Defendant to be placed on SCRAM).

Atty. Martinez presented arguments to the court.
State objects and presented arguments to the court.
Response presented.

Court Grants - Defense Request.
Court Modifies Bail on Case:  15CM1356.
WCS to be Notified to place the defendant back on SCRAM either this afternoon or tomorrow.
Cash Bond Reduced to $250 (from $1,250).
Court orders the $1,000 be Refunded directly to WCS for Payment of SCRAM.
CONDITIONS:
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  
Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  
Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.
Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  
Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.
